name: places/ChIJXysA92JZwokRS5FdYCG622g
formattedAddress: 18 E 41st Street First Floor, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 18 E 41st Street First Floor, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: I was referred for an urgent appointment from another provider. When I came in for this appointment, Dr. Podolsky acted as if I shouldn’t be there and if my symptoms weren’t a big deal at all (not in a comforting way, more like in a “you’re an idiot and why are you here” way). Having pelvic pain is scary enough and it’s not a good feeling to have those symptoms belittled. Then she sends me for an ultrasound. Instead of calling me to tell me the results, she sends me a message in my chart with an entirely new diagnosis that was concerning. She did not call to explain it, just sent a message. I had several questions and sent them in, it has been 8 days and she has not responded. She suggested I set up a video visit in the initial message - so she can charge my insurance again to for me information instead of actually doing her job and letting me know right away. I had to take off from work for the initial appointment and now I have to use one of my days off for a video visit just because she couldn’t actually follow up with me to begin with. She was rude to begin with and now just isn’t even doing her job. Find a different OBGYN.

originalText.text: Our total visit time was 6 min, she interrupted multiple times, didn't really address my concerns. She doesn't have a good bedside manner at all. Didn't care to look at medical records I provided. Look for another provider. Waste of time and money.

text.text: Our total visit time was 6 min, she interrupted multiple times, didn't really address my concerns. She doesn't have a good bedside manner at all. Didn't care to look at medical records I provided. Look for another provider. Waste of time and money.

originalText.text:
First I want to start off by saying I never write reviews of anything. That being said, my experiences with Dr. Podolsky are ones that I think I should speak out on, in the hopes that an individual in my position will perhaps be able to avoid some of the frustrations I have with her, by simply going to a different provider.

I have been a patient of Dr. Podolsky for about a year

I had my annual appointment with Dr. Podolsky  to discuss my options for the management of my endometriosis pain. She is always very cold, curt and quite frankly acts annoyed at the fact that she even has to be there. She kept cutting me off before I could even complete a sentence and I felt like I was a major inconvenience to her. She showed no interest in
engaging with me about my health concerns and was totally condescending and dismissive of my pain.

Luckily for me I do not have to stick with Dr. Podolsky and I have already switched providers.

originalText.text: Where do I even begin… well, let’s start by stating that I live two hours away from the clinic and I took off work to make it to an appointment that was scheduled I think four months in advance. I left my house at 2:00 to catch a train that was supposed to leave at 2:15. That train got delayed, never came and when it did , it just stayed in the station for at least 15 minutes before departing. As soon as I realized that I wasn’t going to make it on time I called their office. Mind you my appointment was at 3:20. I called them at 2:29 to let them know the situation and what happened. They told me Podolsky has a very strict policy and she won’t see me past my appointment time. I re explained to the lady on the phone the situation and the gravity of my needs. Like I left two hours early from an interpreting session to make it there, paid the train fare for nothing. I haven’t had a check up since 2018 and I really needed to see the Dr. made huge efforts. I understand that you have your policy in place and you have to follow it, but we’re humans and have no control over certain things, and I made it there at 3:45 but couldn’t get to see the doctor. Only two people sitting in the waiting area, not even sure if they were her patients and she just turned me away. After explaining everything, after the lady told me that they might be able to see me if there’s only two patients or 1 there. After waiting months to book that appointment.

originalText.text: I met with the doctor once. The office was big and clean with friendly staff. Dr Podolsky was in a rush but I was 15 minutes late so I didn't mind. I asked her do to a urine culture and she agreed. It turned out I had a uti and she got back to me very promptly and had already sent antibiotics to my pharmacy. I wrote to her on MyChart and she got back very promptly. I saw the urine culture test, but there seemed to be no urinalysis. I asked if she did one, she replied she hadn't. I asked if without the urinalysis if we could be sure I actually had a uti, and if so then since I had had 2 recently,  should be on antibiotics longer. She replied that I had a uti based on the culture and that she prescribed the recommended course of treatment and then she blocked me so that I couldn't reply again.
